author: Dennis P. Groth and Edward L. Robertson
title: An Entropy-based Approach to Visualizing Database Structure
window: The data we use in our visualization is drawn from a variety of sources, including the U.S. Census [1], the U.C.I. Machine Learning Repository [2], and the Wisconsin Benchmark [7]. The specific dataset we used for the Census was the 1990 Indiana Public Use Microdata Sample (PUMS), which has 125 attributes. Our first application is the visualization of frequency distributions.
